item.description: Between 33% and 46% of Ph.D. Students donâ€™t complete their degree [1]. I donâ€™t know about you, but that sends shivers down my spine. In my reading and previous article on how to succeed with oneâ€™s doctoral pursuits, we discussed the many ways that professors have seen graduate students fail to finish their degrees. While most agree on the big things: write consistently, learn by doing, donâ€™t aim too high or low, a major point of contention was time management.
